thread.title: Texas mascot Bevo fighting life-threatening illness
thread.title_full: Texas mascot Bevo fighting life-threatening illness - KCTV5

author: cbs8
title: Texas mascot Bevo fighting life-threatening illness
text:
(KEYE/CNN) - University of Texas Longhorns mascot Bevo XIV will not make the trip to Dallas for Saturdayâ€™s Texas/OU Red River Showdown because of a serious illness.
The school released a statement Wednesday saying the 2,100 pound national champion grand show steer has "a life-threatening condition."
Bevo took over as UT mascot at the start of the 2004 season when he was 2 years old. Since then, Texas has gone 106-41 with 10 bowl appearances.
Bevo even attended President George W. Bush's 2005 inauguration.
The Silver Spurs Alumni Association oversees his care.
They promise to update the public when more is known about Bevo's condition.
